title: How to Store Egg Leftovers

steps.headline: Store fresh egg yolk in a bowl.
steps.description: Cover the egg yolks with water.

steps.headline: Place a lid or layer of plastic wrap over the bowl.
Place the egg white in a covered container.
steps.description: Be sure to seal the lid properly. This method can be used for a whole cracked egg as well.

steps.headline: Place the container in the refrigerator.
Place whole eggs in the freezer.
steps.description: They will keep for up to 6 months provided they are stored below -15ºC.

steps.headline: Keep egg whites in the freezer.
steps.description: They will keep for up to 9 months.

steps.headline: Keep frozen eggs covered to prevent dehydration.

text: Egg yolk Store fresh egg yolk in a bowl. Cover the egg yolks with water. Place a lid or layer of plastic wrap over the bowl.  Place in the refrigerator. Use within 2 days. Egg whites Place the egg white in a covered container. Be sure to seal the lid properly. This method can be used for a whole cracked egg as well. Place the container in the refrigerator. Use within 2 days. Freezing Place whole eggs in the freezer. They will keep for up to 6 months provided they are stored below -15ºC. Keep egg whites in the freezer. They will keep for up to 9 months. Keep frozen eggs covered to prevent dehydration.
